intro: Jacquemontia hastigera, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant, showy blooms in shades of pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its ornamental value and its role in local ecosystems.
